text: <!channel> - had a quick chat with Josh. He said our initial outline for case study, video, and PR plan looks great. He’s forwarding us to a PR person on their side who will likely have some additional thoughts, but is going to be pushing to have everything we outlined in place.
My hunch is that they’ll have their own thoughts about the PR portions of it (e.g. specific writers at different publications), but that the overall outline will stick.
Oh?
What is this outline??
one sec, will add you to a working doc that justin has been working on
RAD!
the goal was to have he and his team make sure we were on a path that they’d agree to before we dove TOO far
gotcha
but we have initial approval on direction, and he’s looking into opportunities to get us into the lab on a non-used day for additional footage
What would uncorks next steps be?

I think we have a few: 

1) Start getting specific with case study writing. What’s the narrative arc? What are the asssets we need to tell the story both in video and otherwise? 

2) Solidify an approach for video case stud(y/ies). What’s a motif that we think will work? What shots do we have? What are we missing? 

3) Be in contact with the PR person he’s going to get for us. Talk with that person about all of the above, including things like our rollout plan/social media use/etc.
we have clearance on 1/2 already
3 will be coming soon
but it’s a huge hurdle to get through — A resounding yes that it sounds perfect and that we should go for it
i’m 100% certain the PR folks will introduce some new variables to the mix, but for now, we have a full steam ahead green light.
which is pretty fantastic

additionally - typing here for efficiency: 

Josh is putting together a google doc of all known projects for 2017. These range from the laser cut notebooks that we prototyped awhile ago to a modified cubby wall for Paris and NY (to start). In background, we’ve been working on ways to best structure working arrangements between Uncorked and Google, especially as these projects continue to blend together. 

We’ve already woven a fairly complex fabric of ideas and initiatives. They’re excited about all of them, and are looking especially to 2017 to really expand. 

Buckle up!
Gotcha! Im curious if Emily and I should move forward with an “example” video we were talking about earlier this week - it was more to play with tone and what not.
I would say yes, for sure
Nothing we’ve talked about so far even touches on the sorts of things Google is going to object to
You can’t lasercut a Moleskin, <@U0265G76F>
oh believe me, i know <@U0J6TE0CA>
we should forget all about it. Bad idea

and following up — We are clear to film on an off day in BrandLab. Typically they require the PR person be there with us to offer guidance on what will be ‘approved’. So next steps overall are to work with the PR folks
